content: Each year since 2018, the University of Southern California’s Annenberg Inclusion Initiative has tracked the number of women credited on the music industry’s biggest hits, and the numbers have usually been dismal — year after year, female artists, songwriters and producers have been crowded out by men, sometimes by extraordinary margins.
source.name: The New York Times

author: By Amelia Nierenberg
title: Wednesday Briefing: Imran Khan Gets 10 Years
description: Also, a possible Israel-Hamas deal and a security proposal in Hong Kong.
content: Imran Khan, Pakistan’s former prime minister, was sentenced to 10 years in prison yesterday. The verdict is widely seen as part of a military campaign to sideline him and his party, and comes about a week before the country’s first national election since Khan was ousted in April 2022.
source.name: The New York Times

author: By Stephanie Saul
title: Virginia Moves to End Legacy Admissions at Its Public Universities
description: The state legislature overwhelmingly passed a bill that ends preferences for children of alumni. The governor appears poised to sign it.
content: Virginia is on track to ban legacy preferences at its public universities, which give a boost to children of alumni who apply for admission.
source.name: The New York Times

author: By Bret Stephens
title: Abolish the U.N.’s Palestinian Refugee Agency
description: UNRWA’s problem goes much deeper than charges that it is infested with terrorists.
content: United Nations agencies and officials are no strangers to scandal and infamy.
source.name: The New York Times

author: Compiled by Jeremy Engle
title: Weekly Student News Quiz: Oscar Nominations, Football, Primaries
description: Have you been paying attention to the news recently? See how many of these 10 questions you can get right.
content: Have you been paying attention to the news recently? See how many of these 10 questions you can get right.
source.name: The New York Times

author: By Michael Roston
title: 6 Great Space Images in January
description: A rocket launching from the ocean, an asteroid hits Earth's atmosphere and more out of this world visual highlights from the past month.
content: A rocket launching from the ocean, an asteroid hits Earth's atmosphere and more out of this world visual highlights from the past month.
source.name: The New York Times

author: By Carl Nagle, Via Storyful
title: Monkey Eats From Bird Feeder After Escaping Scottish Wildlife Park
description: A Japanese macaque was spotted in a man’s backyard after it escaped from Highland Wildlife Park in Scotland.
content: A Japanese macaque was spotted in a man’s backyard after it escaped from Highland Wildlife Park in Scotland.
source.name: The New York Times

author: By Storyful
title: Video Shows Gunmen Storming West Bank Hospital
description: The Palestinian Authority Health Ministry released surveillance video that shows armed members of Israeli forces dressed in civilian clothes inside Ibn Sina Specialized Hospital in Jenin.
content: The Palestinian Authority Health Ministry released surveillance video that shows armed members of Israeli forces dressed in civilian clothes inside Ibn Sina Specialized Hospital in Jenin.
source.name: The New York Times

author: By Petr Lom and Corinne van Egeraat
title: Letter to San Zaw Htway
description: After the 2021 military coup in Myanmar, loved ones of the deceased artist and political prisoner San Zaw Htway wrote him letters as an act of remembrance and hope.
content: After the 2021 military coup in Myanmar, loved ones of the deceased artist and political prisoner San Zaw Htway wrote him letters as an act of remembrance and hope.
source.name: The New York Times

author: By Storyful
title: Video Shows Gunmen Storming West Bank Hospital
description: The Palestinian Authority Health Ministry released surveillance video that shows several armed Israeli forces dressed in civilian clothes inside Ibn Sina Specialized Hospital in Jenin.
content: The Palestinian Authority Health Ministry released surveillance video that shows several armed Israeli forces dressed in civilian clothes inside Ibn Sina Specialized Hospital in Jenin.
source.name: The New York Times

author: By Mark Boyer, Claire Hogan, Gabriel Blanco, James Surdam and Jonathan Swan
title: Trump Is Turning Court Appearances Into Campaign Stops
description: The New York Times’ Jonathan Swan analyzes Donald J. Trump’s campaign strategy in the court room.
content: The New York Times’ Jonathan Swan analyzes Donald J. Trump’s campaign strategy in the court room.
source.name: The New York Times
